alston.minecraft

Class Sunlight

  • java.lang.Object
    • alston.minecraft.Sunlight
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Sunlight
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Sunlight as defined by this class proporgates light from the top to bottom of every X/Z components in the 3D Vector Space, and will put a Light on the Block that it hits.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sunlight(Chunk parent, float intensity)
      Creates a new Sunlight; Note that setupLighting() must be called at least once on a full Chunk in order for the effects to apply.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void factorIntensity(float factor)
      Changes all the intensities of the influenced Blocks by the given factor (does not change the original intensity value).
      void setupLighting()
      Adds a PointLight to every single x and z component at the surfaceHeight.
      void updateAllLights()
      Updates all lights in sunlight.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sunlight

        public Sunlight(Chunk parent,
        float intensity)
        Creates a new Sunlight; Note that setupLighting() must be called at least once on a full Chunk in order for the effects to apply.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent that this Sunlight will light up
        intensity - The intensity of the lights

    • Method Detail

      • setupLighting

        public final void setupLighting()
        Adds a PointLight to every single x and z component at the surfaceHeight.

      • updateAllLights

        public void updateAllLights()
        Updates all lights in sunlight.

      • factorIntensity

        public void factorIntensity(float factor)
        Changes all the intensities of the influenced Blocks by the given factor (does not change the original intensity value).
        Parameters:
        factor - The factor of the original intensity to change to.
